title: How to Eat Celery
steps: Make celery soup.
Make stewed celery.
Chop celery into a salad.
Cook celery in a stir-fry.

title: How to Use Celery
steps: Select the celery.
Enjoy celery raw.
Stir-fry celery.
Turn celery into soup.
Add celery to stews and casseroles.
Use the celery leaves.

title: How to Cook Celery
steps: Rinse off the celery and cut the stalks into thin matchsticks.
Heat a skillet or frying pan over high heat.
Add 1 to 2 tablespoons (15 to 30 ml) 1-2 tablespoons of vegetable oil.
Sauté the celery pieces for 3-5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Season the sautéed celery however you’d like and serve it.

title: How to Eat Cabbage
steps: Toss some cabbage in your soup to add nutrients.
Wrap cabbage leaves around ground meat to make stuffed cabbage rolls.
Make corned beef and cabbage for a traditional Irish meal.
Cook cabbage with pork or bacon for a savory main dish.
Make cabbage into spicy kimchi for a Korean fermented condiment.

title: How to Eat with Chopsticks
steps: Know the rules when sharing food.
Know what to do with them when not eating.
When eating rice, be willing to dig in.

title: How to Cook Celery Root
steps: Peel your celery root, apples, and potatoes.
Cut the celery root, apples, and potatoes into 1 inch (2.5 cm) chunks.
Heat 3 tbsp (45ml) of olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Add leek to the saucepan and cook until it's soft and semi-transparent.
Put the diced ingredients, salt, pepper, and garlic into the saucepan.
Add the water and broth to the mixture and bring it to a boil.
Cover the pan and reduce the heat to low.
Remove 1 cup (200ml) of liquid from the pan.
Use a blender to blend the ingredients into a liquid.
Return the soup to the saucepan and place it over low heat.
Serve the soup in a bowl or a cup.

title: How to Prepare Celeriac
steps: Select the celeriac.
Remove the skin before use.
Immerse the cut celeriac immediately in a bowl of water which has had some lemon juice added to it.
Cook with celeriac.

title: How to Eat Asparagus
steps: Blanch the asparagus.
Stir-fry your asparagus.
Fry asparagus with bacon.
Make cream of asparagus soup.
Dice asparagus into an egg recipe.
Eat asparagus raw.
Add asparagus to a smoothie.

title: How to Drink Bone Broth
steps: Add healthy fats to your broth.
Make your bone broth spicy!.
Clear your sinuses by adding household ingredients.
Drink bone broth in a smoothie.

title: How to Eat Dandelions
steps: Prep your onion and greens.
Heat your vegetable stock.
Heat your oil and butter.
Saute the rice and white onions.
Add the liquids and dandelion greens.
Test for texture, season, and serve.

title: How to Eat Tempeh
steps: Cook crumbled tempeh into pasta sauce.
Sprinkle crumbled tempeh over your salad.
Mix crumbled tempeh into a soup, stew, or chili.
Use crumbled tempeh to make burger patties.
